Title: A DNA Mix-Up Involving a Washing Machine Kept a Man in Jail for 3 Years
Lead Paragraph: The Louisiana case highlights how prosecutors and crime labs withhold key documents from defense lawyers, keeping some defendants in custody for months or years.

Title: The Radical Quilting of Rosie Lee Tompkins
Lead Paragraph: A triumphal retrospective at the Berkeley Art Museum confirms her standing as one of the great American artists — transcending craft, challenging painting and reshaping the canon.

Title: Wirecard Goes Bust as Scandal Puts Focus on German Oversight
Lead Paragraph: An accounting scandal at one of Germany’s fastest-growing blue-chip companies has raised doubts about the national financial watchdog and, coming on top of other high-profile cases of fraud, led to questions about the country’s ability to oversee its corporate titans.

Title: Wirecard Scandal Puts Spotlight on German Company Regulation
Lead Paragraph: An accounting scandal at one of Germany’s fastest-growing blue-chip companies has raised doubts about the national financial watchdog and, coming on top of other high-profile cases of fraud, led to questions about the country’s ability to oversee its corporate titans.

Title: Why Do We Pay So Many People So Little Money?
Lead Paragraph: The coronavirus pandemic is forcing America to confront its epidemic low-wage problem.

Title: AI Chatbot Firm Rasa Raises Funding From Andreessen Horowitz, Accel
Lead Paragraph: Rasa, a small artificial intelligence-backed chatbot company, said on Tuesday it had raised $26 million from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Accel Partners to fund more machine learning research and to add more products.

Title: Trump Didn’t ‘Send In the Troops.’ They Were Already There.
Lead Paragraph: Police officers today can turn out with more weaponry than I had in 1992, as a Marine deployed to a burning Los Angeles. What does it mean to project this much force at home?

Title: Fitting a Family of Five Into a One-Bedroom in Brooklyn
Lead Paragraph: It was already challenging before the pandemic. Then the stay-at-home order made it more complicated.

Title: Political Grip Shaky, Belarus Leader Blames Longtime Ally: Russia
Lead Paragraph: Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, who used to call his political foes stooges of the West, is now trying to play on anti-Russian sentiment at home and abroad.

Title: 8 Hospitals in 15 Hours: A Pregnant Woman’s Crisis in the Pandemic
Lead Paragraph: Her baby was coming, and her complications were growing more dangerous. But nowhere would take her — an increasingly common story as India’s health care system buckles under pressure.

Title: Trump’s ‘What Do You Have to Lose?’ Presidency Is Rallying Again
Lead Paragraph: As an encapsulation of the president’s worldview, some former associates say, there is perhaps no beating the text of a campaign waiver: “guests voluntarily assume all risks.”

Title: Here’s What Companies Are Promising to Do to Fight Racism
Lead Paragraph: Corporate America has pledged millions to social justice efforts since the killing of George Floyd. But some businesses have gone further, committing to concrete changes in their practices.

Title: DACA Lives On
Lead Paragraph: And what else you need to know today.

Title: Japan's Fujitsu Brings Hand Washing AI to COVID-19 Fight
Lead Paragraph: Three months after the World Health Organization recommended singing "Happy Birthday" twice during hand washing to fight the coronavirus, Japan's Fujitsu Ltd has developed an artificial intelligence monitor it says will ensure healthcare, hotel and food industry workers scrub properly.

Title: So You’re Thinking About Riding a Bike
Lead Paragraph: These days, with limits on public transportation and daily protests, cyclists dominate cities around the country. Here’s how to become one.

Title: Trump Superfans Line Up Early for Tulsa Rally
Lead Paragraph: Global cases are surging, with two days of record highs. California’s governor ordered people to wear masks in most indoor settings. Japan’s prime minister lifted a virus-related domestic travel ban.

Title: China Pledges Continued Economic Support but Warns of Liquidity Hangover
Lead Paragraph: China will maintain ample financial system liquidity in the second half of the year as the economy recovers from the coronavirus but will need to consider withdrawing that support at some point, its central bank governor warned on Thursday.

Title: Collar the Cat!
Lead Paragraph: This essay, by Abel John, is one of the top 9 winners in the high school category of our Seventh Annual Student Editorial Contest for which we received 6,076 entries.

Title: Runners-Up From Our 7th Annual Student Editorial Contest
Lead Paragraph: The 2020 election, animal rights, health care, theater and librarians: 21 teenage runners-up take on the issues that matter most to them.

Title: Our Lives Happen in Restaurants
Lead Paragraph: Renowned writers remember some of their funniest, best, strangest and most memorable meals out.

Title: Casinos, Airlines, Seek Return to Normality
Lead Paragraph: The outbreak of the coronavirus has dealt a shock to the global economy with unprecedented speed. Following are developments Tuesday related to the national and global response, the work place and the spread of the virus.

Title: Cheap Drug Is First Shown to Improve COVID-19 Survival
Lead Paragraph: Researchers in England say they have the first evidence that a drug can improve COVID-19 survival: A cheap, widely available steroid reduced deaths by up to one third in severely ill hospitalized patients.

Title: Riding Out Quarantine With a Chatbot Friend: ‘I Feel Very Connected’
Lead Paragraph: The digital companions may sound like science fiction. But when social isolation became the norm, they helped deal with the loneliness, some users say.

Title: Who’s a Bot? Who’s Not?
Lead Paragraph: It sometimes seems that automated bots are taking over social media and driving human discourse. But some (real) researchers aren’t so sure.

Title: The Artist’s Caretaker: Once He Controlled Everything. No More.
Lead Paragraph: When Robert Indiana died, the man who had directed his affairs was supposed to help run the artist’s foundation and its new museum. Those plans have changed.

Title: We Went Inside a Sports ‘Bubble.’ Here’s What We Saw.
Lead Paragraph: Boxers wearing surgical booties. Wristbands with bar codes. Meals served behind plexiglass. Our journalists took a look behind the scenes of boxing’s comeback in Las Vegas.

Title: A Date to Remember
Lead Paragraph: Sam Thirlwall and Caitlin Halla met at work and felt an instant connection. Slack messages became text messages became long emails, and then a first date.

Title: Georgia Havoc Raises New Doubts on Pricey Voting Machines
Lead Paragraph: Long before this week’s election chaos, experts had warned Georgia about its over $100 million voting system, saying paper ballots were simpler and safer.

Title: The Swinging, Jamming Musical Charms of 1940s Soundies
Lead Paragraph: Once upon a time you could drop a dime in a movie jukebox to hear — and watch — musical greats like Duke Ellington and Gene Krupa.

Title: Covid-19 Patient Gets Double Lung Transplant, Offering Hope for Others
Lead Paragraph: The operation is believed to be the first of its kind in the U.S. The patient, a woman in her 20s, had been healthy, but the coronavirus devastated her lungs.

Title: Georgia’s Election Mess: Many Problems, Plenty of Blame, Few Solutions for November
Lead Paragraph: Tuesday’s disastrous primary election was plagued by glitches, but Democrats also saw a systemic effort to disenfranchise voters.

Lead Paragraph: Online financial service companies are filling a gap, especially as companies have altered how they work.

Lead Paragraph: It is heading toward “Out of Many, None,” and I fear it becoming “Out of Many, Me.”

Lead Paragraph: Long lines and malfunctioning voting machines marred statewide primary elections in Georgia, renewing attention on voting rights there.
